result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Isaac N Hamilton

defendant.name: Hamilton, Isaac N
defendant.address: W1037 Green Rd., Genoa City, WI 53128

records.addlTxt:
Adjustment Number: 22A 362106,
Payable Number: 269952,
Receipt Number: 22R 020857,
Amount: $20.00

*AMENDED 11-02-2022: NO VIOLENT CONTACT WITH A.R.F. dob 1-8-1986. "No violent contact" includes threats through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person or through a third party.

Defendant Isaac N Hamilton in court.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney John Dade appeared. Victim present and would like no contact removed. Motion to modify bond by Attorney Dade. State objects to bond motion. Motion granted, bond amended to no violent contact. Defendant would like PTS condition removed, State objects. Court will not removed PTS condition. Defendant given complaint; charges/penalties explained by the court. Defendant stands mute, court enters not guilty plea. Demand for speedy trial made by defendant. Minutes filed.
Final pre-trial scheduled for November 23, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for December 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Plaintiff's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt: Notice of Motion and Motion for Establishment of Discovery Deadlines.
records.descr: Notice of motion and motion for discovery

records.addlTxt: Victim's request to lift no contact.
Defendant's request to lift no contact with control plan.
Signed bond filed with the court.

*AMENDED 11-02-2022: NO VIOLENT CONTACT WITH A.R.F. dob 1-8-1986. "No violent contact" includes threats through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person or through a third party.

COMPLY WITH PRETRIAL SERVICES. Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH A.R.F. dob 1-8-1986. If defendant and victim(s) are living together, defendant may go to their residence once with a police officer to retrieve the defendant's personal belongings. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

Defendant Isaac N Hamilton in court, in custody by video. JJ Crawford appeared for the State of WIsconsin. Attorney John Dade for defendant. Victim not able to attend today's hearing. Court inquired if victim wished to be heard; no statement made. Signature bond set. Minutes filed.
Hearing scheduled for November 2, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
